text: Pours a brassy gold with a white head. Aroma is soft and sweet, honey and yogurt with floral notes of Aesculus and Ceanothus, plus barbs of lemon and lime and a subtle gin accent. Flavor is a fabulous balance of sharp tangerine sourness, apricot Stilton cheese, and chardonnay. An acidic punch lingers long after each sip. Carbonation is just right, finish is dry and graceful.

From notes. Had at a tasting with the group at Eriks house on January 22. 750 mL bottle. The pour is a darker golden orange with a small white head that lingers for a bit as a thin ring. The aroma is nice and clean. There is a good light fruitiness to it, a hint of citrus sour, a light barnyard funk, and a touch of oak going on. Its clean, balanced, and lovely. The flavor is much of the same. Light tropical fruits and citrus sourness up front, a solid dusty barnyard moving through toward the back, and a hint of graininess as it wraps up. Its not complex by any means, but is really clean and crisp. The mouth feel is light and well carbonated with a lingeringly funky tropical fruit and a hint of sourness on the back end. This is another great saison from SARA.
Ya these are some really damn good beers, just really nice and tart and lightly woody and overall beautiful, I love me some SARA.

Merci à Rémi pour le partage. Une vraie bombe dans le domaine Saison! Liquide à l robe profondément orangée et presque sans bulles malgré une forte agitation carbonique dans mon verre. Beaucoup de fruits et de complexité dans cette bière pourtant non fruitée et funky à souhait! J passe de la clémentine, à la pêche à chair blanche, en passant par de la pomme et de labricot. Remarquable complexité, tant dans le fruit que dans un funk vivant, jeune et vigoureux. Attaque ponctuée par une effervescence qui ne séteint jamais. Une saison sauvage des mieux réussies à mon avis!

bottle shared by a friend at our tasting. it poured to one of the most beautiful saison colours i have ever seen. first pours where clean clear gold, poured the entire bottle 4-ways, it turned into a delicate clouded yellow golden with orange colours and a lasting white light head on top. they are right the this has to be one of not their best beer. the wine barrel aroma is just insane! combined with a clean balanced funky acidity, juicy white wine, light sour white grapes, clean melon, crisp grains, oak, vinous tart white wine, vanilla oak, lemon tartness, sweet tropical fruit. taste even show a sweet apricot, layers of different wine barrel notes. what a mouth watering saison. so clean and delicate. this reminds me a lot of the colab they did with hill farmstead (works of love), but this is something from a whole other level. i even enjoyed it more than westly, what a masterpiece. maybe the best saison i have had! amazing experience!

750mL at a tasting. Clearish orange color with big foam. Excellent nectarine and vanilla nose. Taste brings medium acid up front, mid palate is more lemon and a diaper/plastic note. Dry palate and refreshing lemon character paired with high carbonation. Lasting sourness and saltiness in the finish.
Bottle thanks to Chris. Pours a hazy yellow gold with small frothy white head that lasts. The aroma is funk, yeast, oak. Thin mouth, tart, funky, citrus, crushable, very nice.

Poured from a bottle. 
Aroma is very nice with lots of floral and fruit esters. Light pineapple, some mango and apricots. A bit of peaches with some light citrus and hints of acidity. 
Pours a hazy, pale yellow gold with a small, thick, white head the recedes to the edges and lingers. Light lacing and small legs. 
Flavor is nice with lots of stone fruit esters and some medium light acidity. Light grain notes. Lots of peach and apricot notes with some light pineapple and citrus. Medium light bitterness with some light oak notes. 
Mouthfeel is medium light bodied with a soft character and moderate carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, one of their best beers, if not the best of 2015. Great fruit esters with light phenolics and some light oak and white wine characters.
750 ml bottle. Clear yellow pour. Tart. Lemon and apple come together. Some white wine. Big in flavor.
Bottle. Clear yellow pour with a white head. Mild lemon zest aroma. Hints of oak with yeast highlights. Average body and mouthfeel.

750 mL bottle. Clear yellow. White wine and oak aroma. Light lemon. Taste has a surprising vanilla flavor. Lemony tartness. Kinda tropical. Oak in the back end with a lingering wine flavor. Medium carbonation. Kinda indistinguishable from other good wine barrel saisons, which doesnt say much, but its very good.

A- pours a murky, dirty golden yellow. Faint off white head that thins to a gossamer clingy ring. Minor lacing.

S- wonderful wine vinegar, fruit cobbler, lemons, ripe apples, grapes, melon. Brett and oak notes. Some pastry crust and butter. 

M- light to medium acidic and sharp body. 

T- tart apples, citrus and brett opening. Some astringency. Lightly tannic, oaky, with more vinegar and other vinous qualities. Sourdough. Lime juice, honeydew, and unripe berries.

Bottle @ La Palma Sour Fest 2015. Nice light haze to the golden beer with white foam. Nice lacing. Light yeast and rye bread sort of aromas. Theres a good bit of straw, some lemon zest, and a touch of mineral oil. Just a hint of tang to the flavor. Subtle melon and fruit esters on the back end, too. Light and easy drinking. Well done as usual.

750ml bottle shared by ineedbeer @ Fermentoren, thanks! Pours hazy yellow with a few small floaties, small white head. Aroma is lemon, lime, apricot and oak. Flavour is light tart and salty. Light bodied, lively carbonation. Finish is fresh, slightly funky, salty and light tart.
Bottle. Thanks Joe. Pours yellow white head. Nose/taste of white wine, lemon, oak and sour funk - medium body.
Bottle. Got the bottom. Hazy and sediment pour with golden tones and white head. Stone fruit, Brett and sour aromas. Peach, stone fruit, yeast and spice Flavors, tart and yeast Flavors.

Thanks to the Tampa Crew for sharing this one! Cheers, my friends! Pours a hay yellow with a white head. Nose is grain, sweet malt, lemon, some citrus, oak, some vinous character, and some light funk. Flavor is similar with lemon, oak, citrus, vinous, and some mild funk. Light in body and vey nice overall.

Bottle graciously shared by Frank daddy. Cheers brah. Pours murky hazy golden with small white head. Notes of lemon skin, rich oak, vino and other bright citrus SARA juice. This is tart as fuck, clean as fuck, and juicy as fuck juice for Dads. Some light chalky and sugar notes as it warmed a bit. Tasty

Bottle courtesy of Frank at bills. Pours a beautiful bright hazy orange with thin white lacing. Mouthfeel is bright and balanced with notes of sour peach, funky lemons, oak, tart starfruit, earthy funk and limeade. Light sea salt on the palate in the finish. Wow, killer stuff.

Bazinga. First rate. Thanks to Nolen for the share! Pours hazy pale golden with a small white head and good lacing. Aroma is light Bretty, oak, some lemon and mineral water, hints of grain. Flavor is light tart, light funky, lots of oak nuances with hints of salt, light stonefruit, ever present Brett and SARA culture, hints phenolic. Lightish body, quite nice.
